sentences: Sina ja mina koos peame otsustama.
context: The Estonian word 'sina' is the second person singular informal pronoun, used to address someone familiarly or informally. It has various case forms including the short form 'sa' in non-nominative positions. This contrasts with the formal/plural 'teie'. The word can appear in different cases depending on its grammatical function: nominative (sina/sa), genitive (sinu/su), partitive (sind), illative (sinusse/susse), etc.
